pages.text: Hemicyclaspis, like the closely related Cephalaspis was probably a bottom feeder, using its shovel shaped head to dig up prey as it foraged the ocean floor for food. It was likely a better swimmer than its relatives because it had a more hydrodynamic head shield
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
